conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, analyze the velocity-time graph.
The x-axis represents time in seconds, and the y-axis represents velocity in meters per second. The curve shows how the velocity changes over time.
We are interested in the interval from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
At t = 0 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s. At t = 10 seconds, the velocity reaches approximately 20 m/s. During this interval, the velocity increases from 0 m/s to 20 m/s.
Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Acceleration a is given by a = Δv/Δt. In the interval from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds, Δv = 20 m/s - 0 m/s = 20 m/s and Δt = 10 s - 0 s = 10 s, so a = 20 m/s / 10 s = 2 m/s².
Since the velocity is increasing over time, the acceleration is positive. Positive acceleration means the object is speeding up in the direction of its motion.
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is positive, indicating that the skydiver is accelerating downward.
